p: While in HOSUT plants sink activity has been increased, elevated CO 2 signifies increased source activity, which in many plants stimulates photosynthesis and regularly induces faster growth and biomass accumulation ( Amthor, 2001; Jablonski et al., 2002 ). This study analysed how increased sink activity of HOSUT responds to source stimulation and whether additional C provided by CO 2 enrichment can be better used by HOSUT. In parallel, the effects of a heat wave during early grain development and influences from high N fertilization were analysed.
